headline: Row over abuse against PM Modi: BJP-Congress workers clash in Patna — Watch video
body: BJP MLA Nitin Nabin said, "Every son of Bihar will give a befitting reply to Congress for insulting a mother" Congress leader Pawan Khera said that derogatory remarks against the prime minister were made by the BJP "agents" during the rally. A video of some men allegedly hurling abuses at Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his mother went viral. The video, shared on social media by several accounts, showed unidentified individuals using Hindi slurs against PM Modi. The Congress leader is holding a 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar along with RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.

headline: Bihar SIR: RJD moves SC for extension of Sept 1 deadline for filing claims; hearing next week
body: Rashtriya Janata Dal on Friday approached the Supreme Court seeking a week's extension of the September 1 deadline for filing objections and claims on behalf of voters. The Supreme Court has agreed to hear the plea on Monday. Earlier, Supreme Court expressed concern at the lack of political parties’ involvement in correcting names of voters deleted during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of The petitions were filed by RJD MP Manoj Jha, the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR), PUCL, activist Yogendra Yadav, Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra and former Bihar MLA Mujahid Alam.

headline: Israel's ouster from Mumbai event splits Indian scientists
body: Row erupts over conduct of faculty members at International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics. Nearly 300 scientists petition the government to act against colleagues accused of engineering a "boycott" of Israel. They claim this amounted to a "grave misuse" of an international scientific forum. Scientists who moved the resolution cited Israel's ongoing war in Gaza, the destruction of schools and universities as reasons for seeking Israel's suspension. The proposed resolution allowed Israeli students to participate as individuals but barred the state from official representation until it complied with international law.

headline: 'Already registered': R Ashwin signs up for overseas cricket franchise league
body: Former India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has revealed that he has already registered for one of the overseas franchise leagues. The 38-year-old announced his IPL retirement through social media earlier this week. Ashwin ended with 187 wickets in 221 matches across 16 seasons. He also won the IPL twice with Chennai Super Kings. Lovlina Borgohain says he wants to live his life on his terms for his happiness. He says playing cricket and touching lives, while balancing the family's needs, is the ultimate challenge at this stage.

headline: 'Not the smartest': Oracle founder's candid take on Bill Gates; likens him to Rockefeller
body: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison has praised Bill Gates' business acumen. Ellison said that Gates may not be the smartest person in tech, but he is the most relentless. Ellison also compared Gates to industrial titan John D. Rockefeller. Larry Ellison added nearly $100 billion to his net worth this year. He surpassed tech titans like Jeff Bezos and Mark Zuckerberg. Ellison is also witnessing his own meteoric rise in the tech industry.

headline: India's education cost: How much are families paying for fees, books, coaching?
body: Government schools continue to serve as the mainstay of India’s education system, accounting for 55.9% of total student enrolment. Only 26.7% of students in government schools reported paying course fees. Among urban private unaided schools, the proportion rises further to 98%. The average annual household expenditure per student in government schools stands at Rs 2,863. In non-government schools, this amount increases sharply to Rs 25,002. The largest component of spending across all schools is course fees, which average Rs 7,111 per student. Most families fund education without external aid. Only 1.2% cited government scholarships as their main financial source. Urban higher secondary students spent Rs 9,950 on coaching, while their rural counterparts spent Rs 4,548.

headline: EV Homes bags Navi Mumbai cluster redevelopment project
body: EV Homes Constructions Private Limited has been officially appointed as the developer for the redevelopment of Nakshatra CHS. The project is poised to be the largest redevelopment initiative in Navi Mumbai's history. The ambitious undertaking not only cements EV Homes’ leadership in the redevelopment segment but also marks a pivotal chapter in the city’s transformation. The project will deliver cutting-edge infrastructure, upscale commercial spaces and high street retail spaces, and world-class amenities. It will serve as a catalyst in turning Vashi Sector 9 into Navi Mumbai’s next hotspot destination, drawing investors, homeowners, and commercial players alike. Navi Mumbai is witnessing unprecedented interest from developers and investors. EV Homes stands at the forefront of this momentum, with the Nakshatra CHS cluster redevelopment project serving as a beacon of the cityâs potential.

headline: UP Cow Commission, Patanjali join hands to promote cow protection and rural industries
body: The Uttar Pradesh Gau Seva Commission has tied up with Patanjali Yogpeeth to spread cow protection, Panchgavya products, natural farming, and biogas development. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who has consistently emphasized that the cow is the fulcrum of village advancement, has endorsed the scheme. Farming expenses will be reduced. vermicompost will be provided to villages to reduce farming expenses, improve soil fertility, and enhance environmental sustainability. ne, and vermecompost.

headline: Minneapolis shooting: Musk slams CNN for not mentioning Robin Westman was 'trans'
body: Elon Musk took to Twitter to attack CNN for failing to identify the Minneapolis shooter as transgender. The CEO of Tesla and owner of X has a long history of anti-trans ideology. He has mocked pronoun use, derided protections for trans people and pledged to oppose gender-affirming care for minors. Muskâs stance has also drawn attention because of his personal history. His eldest child, once known as Xavier Musk, transitioned in 2020 and is now legally recognised as Vivian Jenna Wilson. Their estrangement has become a symbolic subplot in Musk’s wider war against trans ideology. Two children, aged eight and ten, were killed. Seventeen others, including 14 classmates and three elderly parishioners, were wounded. The response reflected a broader pattern: instead of focusing on gun access or security lapses, much of the right turned the spotlight onto gender ideology.

headline: 'Using our dollars for Russian oil': Trump aide takes 'laundromat' jibe at India again
body: US President Donald Trump's trade advisor Peter Navarro renewed his attack on India. Navarro accused New Delhi of using American trade dollars to finance Russia's war in Ukraine. Indian refiners, working with silent Russian partners, were making huge profits, he said. Navarro said the Biden administration looked the other way at this madness, while President Trump was confronting it directly. Navarro said India now exports more than 1 million barrels a day in refined petroleum, over half of the Russian crude it imports. Navarro also controversially referred to the Russia-Ukraine conflict as âs war. He insisted India’s purchases were funding Moscowâ�aiS aggression. His comments have drawn criticism within US policy circles.

headline: Protest at Microsoft: Company fires 4 employees; workers received voicemails
body: Nisreen Jardat and Julius Shan were fired for a sit-in protest at President Brad Smith’s office. The protest, organised by No Azure for Apartheid demanded Microsoft to terminate its ties with Israel and offer reparations to Palestine. The development comes a day after the company fired Riki Fameli and Anna Hattle after participating in the protest. headline: Zodiac Predictions: Signs That Will Be Blessed by Radha Rani Soon
body: The month of August comes to an end with one of the most auspicious festival, which is celebrated with immense happiness and joy across the nation. Devotees try to seek blessings of Goddess Radha by worshipping with full devotion. Here we are going to talk about certain zodiac signs who will be blessed by Radha Rani and flourish in their life. Leo's are ruled by Sun, the planet of light and power. The natives who belong to Sun will experience a great change in their nature. They will become more spiritually active, visit various religious places and receive the direct blessings of Goddess Radha.

headline: Unseen video: Harbhajan Singh nearly punched Sreesanth in IPL 2008 - Watch
body: Former IPL chairman Lalit Modi claims to possess unseen footage of the incident. The controversy dates back to the inaugural IPL season in 2008. Harbhajan was suspended for the remainder of the season and slapped with an 11-match ban. Harbhajan and Sreesanth's slap-gate incident remains one of the most notorious in IPL history. Modi claims to have an unseen video of the incident. The video allegedly captures the moment television cameras missed.

headline: UP dowry case: Woman forced to drink acid, dies after 17 days
body: Gulfiza had been married to Parvez Ahmad, a small-time farmer, for around a year. On Aug 11, her in-laws allegedly made her consume acid at their home in Kalakhera village in Didauli area. Neighbours immediately informed her family, who took her to hospital in critical condition.

headline: Musk & Altman’s legal tussle: Dispute over Meta 'chat' with Zuckerberg; OpenAI moves court
body: Elon Musk's lawyers are asking a U.S. judge to prevent OpenAI from obtaining documents from rival Meta Platforms. The request is the latest development in a high-stakes lawsuit where Musk is accused of attempting to harm OpenAI through a "sham bid" for its assets. Elon Musk sued OpenAI and its CEO over the company's shift to a for-profit model. OpenAI countersued Musk in April, accusing him of attempting to damage the company. A jury trial for the case is scheduled for spring 2026.

headline: Japanese officials apologise at grave of wrongfully detained man
body: Shizuo Aishima was diagnosed with stomach cancer while he was detained. His lawyer filed bail requests eight times, but all were denied. "We deeply apologise for our illegal probe and arrest," said Tetsuo Kamata.

headline: Maratha quota protest: Mumbai on edge; traffic chokes CSMT, buses stuck for hours
body: Thousands from the Maratha community thronged the roads leading to Azad Maidan. BEST buses and other vehicles remained stuck for over 30 minutes during the morning peak hours. Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange Patil is on an indefinite hunger strike. All vehicular movement except emergency services will be banned starting 6 am Friday. The order was issued by the additional commissioner of police (Traffic) on Thursday evening. The following roads will remain closed for all vehicular traffic except for emergency services.

headline: ‘Draconian tariffs’: Chris Wood sees $55-6bn hit for India
body: Donald Trump administration's move to impose 50% tariffs on India is 'draconian' Jefferies' emerging markets strategist Chris Wood believes that the step will lead to a direct hit of $55-60 billion. Chris Wood further observed that India's ongoing Russian oil purchases have become a major point. Wood highlighted that agricultural imports would be rejected by any Indian administration, considering their severe effects. India's thriving services exports remain untouched, generating $150 billion yearly from IT services. US multinational-established global capability centres in India contribute an additional $60 billion in revenue. The ongoing tariff dispute might result in India strengthening ties with China. Chinese imports to India currently stand at an annualised $118 billion, constituting 16% of total imports. The absence of a clear American foreign policy direction is not in the national interest. headline: Another cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Many families feared trapped in Rudraprayag
body: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand left several families trapped and caused multiple injuries. Chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said debris flows blocked several areas and left many stranded. Rescue and relief operations were under way through the night. Bank holidays, public holidays, and current gold rates and silver prices in your area. headline: Congress rally row: Man accused of abusing PM Modi arrested; to be produced in court
body: Bihar police arrest a man named Mohammad Rizvi for allegedly abusing Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The accused is from Bhopura village in Jale assembly constituency. This comes after a video of some men allegedly hurling abuses at PM Modi and his mother from the venue of Rahul Gandhi's rally went viral. After the video goes viral, former Indian Youth Congress National Secratary, Mohd Naushad apologised for the remarks. He said that he condemned such remarks made against the Prime Minister but suggested that it was possible that this was done by opposition or people with "vested interests"

headline: ​When Anees played young Shatrughan in 1981 film 'Naseeb'
body: Anees Bazmee essayed the role of young Shatrughan Sinha in 1981 blockbuster 'Naseeb' He shared a throwback picture from the sets of the film on Instagram. In the throwback photo, Bazmee is seen dressed smartly in a shirt and tie, with a blazer draped over his shoulder. Master Tito carries a cloth over his arm, symbolizing his role as a waiter.

headline: Param Sundari X review: Film hailed as feel-good entertainer
body: Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor’s rom-com, Param Sundari, has arrived in theatres. On Friday, fans took to Twitter to share their first impressions of the film. Param Sundari has been described as a well-balanced rom-com with humour, drama, and cultural flavours. Viewers appreciate the film’s balanced humour and drama. The film is also described as lighthearted and refreshing. The music of Param Sundariâ has been highlighted as one of the film’s strongest points. Fans repeatedly highlight the chemistry of Sidharth and Janhvi, the engaging storyline, and the catchy music.

headline: Enrique-Anna to welcome 4th child
body: Anna Kournikova and Enrique Iglesias are expecting their fourth child. The couple already have twins, Lucy and Nicholas, and daughter Mary. Anna made headlines in 2008 when she said she had no intention of marrying Enrique. Enrique to perform in India as part of his larger world tour. He will perform in a special concert scheduled for October 30, 2025, in Mumbai. This marks the global pop icon's first performance in India in 13 years.

headline: Gauahar Khan reacts to Amaal Mallik’s comment on Awez
body: Amaal Mallik allegedly claimed that the popular content creators managed to bag opportunities and visibility in the entertainment industry âbecause of him. This comment sparked discussions across social media, especially among fans of Awez and Nagma. Karen Mirajkar is the daughter of former Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi. She is the wife of former Prime Minister of India, Rajan Zedekar. She was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in 2007.

headline: Saudi Arabia’s top local burger chain Hamburgini crashes into bankruptcy, shuts down operations
body: Once operating 57 branches nationwide, Hamburgini collapsed after a 2024 food poisoning incident severely damaged its reputation and sales. The company, registered under commercial number 1010248348, is now undergoing full legal liquidation as part of Saudi Arabia’s Bankruptcy Law framework. Hamburgini quickly became a standout local brand in the fast-food sector. It grew popular among young Saudis due to affordable pricing, daily-prepared meals, and offerings such as smashed burgers, sweet potato fries, real chicken tenderloin, and lettuce burgers. The brand owed much of its expansion to strong digital marketing, savvy social media campaigns, and ambitious leadership under B. idium botulinum bacteria found in Bon Temps mayonnaise, an imported ingredient used in Hamburginiâs food preparation. Authorities from the Ministry of Municipalities and Housing responded by shutting down all branches in Riyadh. Branch closures followed, and the company struggled to meet its financial obligations.

headline: Stunning prediction! 'Shreyas Iyer can captain India to a World Cup win'
body: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo has made a huge prediction on star India batter Shreyas Iyer. Iyer was ignored by the selectors and left out of the 15-member Asia Cup 2025 squad. Lobo believes Iyer’s horoscope is so strong that not only will he make a comeback soon, but he also has the potential to captain India to a Shreyas Iyer will force his way into the T20 squad once again, says astrologer Lobo. Lobo claims Iyer would become a mainstay in the longer formats as well. He also warned against overlooking Iyer in favour of Shubman Gill. Shubman Gill is being forced upon us as a captain in every format. If he becomes captain in all the formats, then someone like Shreyas Iyer will be pushed back. If we have to win more World Cups, then we need different captains in different formats. You cannot keep someone like Iyer away, and he will not be away for long. Mark my words

headline: From Clarke to Yuvraj: Cricketers who battled cancer with courage
body: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke has undergone his sixth surgery for skin cancer. The 44-year-old shared a post-operative picture on Instagram. Clarke was first diagnosed with skin cancer in 2006 during his playing career. Clarke’s story resonates with the journey of another Australian icon, Richie Benaud. Benaud was diagnosed with skin cancer late in life, with lesions on his forehead and scalp. Yuvraj Singh delivered one of the greatest all-round performances in tournament history, scoring 362 runs and taking 15 wickets, all while battling serious health issues. Cricket greats Andy Flower, Graeme Pollock, Martin Crowe and Ian Bell have all faced cancer. Flower was diagnosed with skin cancer while serving as England’s head coach. Pollock was on the brink of bankruptcy, struggling to keep up with mortgage payments. Crowe passed away in 2016 after a brave fight with lymphoma. England wicketkeeper-batter Sam Billings underwent two operations to remove a malignant melanoma from his chest. His condition was detected after he attended a skin cancer screening in Kent. Billings has spoken openly about the dangers of skin cancer.

headline: 201 wickets, one favourite: Tendulkar's pick will surprise you
body: Sachin Tendulkar is celebrated as one of the greatest batters in cricket history. But his bowling remains an often-overlooked part of his game. He could bowl medium pace, off-spin, and leg-spin. He claimed 46 wickets across 200 matches. Tendulkar bowled a deceptive googly that slipped through Moinâs defense and crashed into the stumps. A stunned Moin walked back as India capped the day perfectly. The visitors eventually won the Test by an innings and 52 runs.

headline: Asia Cup 2025: Indian-origin Jatinder Singh to led Oman
body: Oman has named a new-look 17-member squad for their debut Asia Cup appearance. The team, placed in Group A alongside Pakistan, UAE, and India, features four newcomers who could make their international debuts. Oman Cricket captain Jatinder Singh. Mendis emphasized the team's determination to compete at the highest level. "The tournament will not only test their skills but also their mental toughness on one of the most watched platforms in the sport," he said.

headline: Diamond League Final: Neeraj Chopra's event preview, time and live telecast in India
body: Neeraj Chopra will compete in the men's javelin event at the Diamond League Final 2025. The two-day Final begins on Wednesday, with Chopra's event scheduled for Thursday. The remaining 27 Diamond League champions will be decided on Thursday evening at Letzigrund Stadium. The men’s javelin final at the Diamond League 2025 will begin at 11:15 PM IST on Thursday, August 28. The Zurich Final will not be broadcast on television in India. The event will be streamed live on theDiamond League YouTube and Facebook pages.

headline: 71-year-old’s 6-month jail term reduced by Calcutta high court to 9 days after 37 years
body: Swapan Kumar Bera was 34 when he was convicted in 1988 for illegally dealing in diesel and kerosene. He spent nine days in jail following his arrest in 1986 and a Midnapore court sentenced him to jail for six months. Bera spent half his life fighting the case. Justice Biswas said it was well-established in law that âlong delay before courts in taking a final decision with regard to the guilt or otherwise of the accused is one of the mitigating factors for superior courts to take into consideration while taking a decision on the quantum of sentence.

headline: 'Mahavtar Narsimha' is unstoppable as it sees growth on Ganesh Chaturthi, crosses Rs 230 crore, surpasses 'Sitaare Zameen Par', 'Housefull 5'
body: Mahavatar Narsimha continues its strong run at the box office even in its fifth week. The animated film showed a slight jump on its 5th Wednesday, thanks to Ganesh Chaturthi. The total collection of the movie now stands at Rs 237.1 crore, according to Sacnilk. The film will now face fresh competition with the release of 'Param Sundari' this weekend. If the Sidharth Malhotra, Janhvi Kapoor starrer clicks with audiences, Mahavatar Narsimha’s momentum could slow down.

headline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Donald Trump admin taking 15% cut: Whatever it takes to get approval for Nvidia chip sales to China is fine with us
body: N Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says the company is willing to accept the US government terms, including a 15% cut of China sales. Huang estimated that he AI market in China is worth $50 billion to Nvidia. Nvidia has already struck a deal with Trumpâs administration for its H20 AI chips. Huang estimates the China market could be worth $50 billion for the company. Nvidia will help Beijing strengthen its military and AI capabilities. The company will also help the Chinese government develop its own AI technology.

headline: SSC holds re-exam for 59,500 candidates after tech failures: How it happened and what’s changed
body: Staff Selection Commission conducts special re-examination for 59,500 candidates. The re-exam was held in three shifts to accommodate all affected aspirants. SSC also postponed the Combined Graduate Level (CGL) Examination 2025, initially scheduled for August 13. Until June 2025, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) was responsible for conducting SSC exams. From July 2025, Eduquity Career Technologies assumed the role through an open tender. The responsibility for setting question papers has been separated from the exam conducting agency and handed over to independent content providers. The Times of India is a leading newspaper in India. It is one of the most read newspapers in the world. It was founded in 1858 and is based in New Delhi. It has a print edition of 1,000 copies every day.

headline: This country has the most lions in the world and its name begins with the letter ‘T’
body: Tanzania has the largest number of lions in the wild today in the whole wide world. The country is often regarded as the âLion Capital of the World’ Tanzania has kept aside more land for wildlife as compared to other countries in Africa. The global lion population has dropped from over 200,000 a century ago to fewer than 25,000 today (IUCN Red List). These big cats today come under the Vulnerable category. There are certain regional populations, like those in West Africa, at the brink of extinction.

headline: Paryushan beyond fasting: The culture of mindful eating
body: Paryushan is one of the most important festivals for the Jain community. It is a period of deep reflection, discipline, and spiritual cleansing. The festival involves plant-based diets, avoiding root vegetables, and fasting. During Paryushan, meals are prepared with deep consciousness about the harm they may cause to other living beings. Foods that are lighter, plant-based, and non-violent in their preparation are chosen. Green vegetables, lentils, grains, fruits, and pulses become the staples. Paryushan is about asking for forgiveness for all the wrong doings you might have done knowingly or unknowingly. Mindful eating, plant-based diets, and sustainability have become popular buzzwords in modern wellness. These values have been a way of life in Jainism for centuries. Mindful eating is not just about what is on the plate, but about how we approach food. Eating without distractions, finishing what is served, expressing gratitude before meals, and reflecting on the journey of food from farm to plate are simple ways to bring the spirit of Paryushan into everyday life.

headline: 2025 Renault Kiger review: Has Kiger finally cracked the code?
body: The Renault Kiger has always been pitched as a sub-4 meter compact SUV with big ambitions. At its price tag the model also cuts several popular hatchbacks in India. The Kiger’s sales may not have lived up to Renaultâs expectations, but that could soon change. From the inside, the cabin feels familiar but more premium than before. The dashboard layout is neat and Renault has tried to maximise space. The seats are well-cushioned, though a bit more under-thigh support at the rear would have been welcome on longer drives. The Renault Kiger has a 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine paired with a CVT. It produces 100 hp and 152 Nm of torque. There is also a manual version, and alongside the turbo, Renault continues to offer a NA petrol unit. The Renault Kiger has always stood out for offering SUV appeal at hatchback money. With prices starting at Rs 6.29 lakh, it undercuts several premium hatchbacks. Renault has worked on the finer details: sharper styling, a more premium cabin feel, added features, and improved refinement.
